body:
Comment 1: 
The correct use of goinstall is to give the full path to the package
you want to install.  Any required dependencies will be installed
automatically.

You can't goinstall SDL because of the cgo problem, but in general
you have to goinstall the directory with the code, so it would be

goinstall github.com/banthar/Go-SDL/sdl

for example.  Or goinstall on a program that
imported "github.com/banthar/Go-SDL/sdl".
But again it doesn't play well with cgo yet.

"godoc goinstall" will explain more.
_Owner changed to **r...@golang.org**._ _Status changed to **WorkingAsIntended**._
